p: A complete review of the ways in which HIV epidemiology has changed since the MACS and WIHS were established could fill volumes. Here we focus on selected ways in which the science of HIV epidemiology in the United States has evolved and influenced the design of the new MWCCS. We structure the paper along the lines of 3 key domains that are central to the “epidemiologic approach” ( 9): populations, measurement, and inferences made via population comparisons.
